text: Frank Beall Ryan (July 12, 1936 - January 1, 2024) was an American professional football player. He was born in Fort Worth, Texas. He was a quarterback in the National Football League (NFL) for the Los Angeles Rams from 1958 to 1961, Cleveland Browns from 1962 to 1968 and Washington Redskins from 1969 to 1970. Ryan was also a mathematician and was a faculty member at Case Western Reserve University from 1967 to 1974. Ryan died at a nursing home in Waterford, Connecticut on January 1, 2024 from problems caused by Alzheimer's disease, aged 87. ==References== ==Other websites== * * * Frank Ryan's dissertation Category:1936 births Category:2024 deaths Category:American football quarterbacks Category:Los Angeles Rams players Category:Cleveland Browns players Category:Washington Redskins players Category:American mathematicians Category:Sportspeople from Fort Worth, Texas Category:Academics from Texas Category:Writers from Fort Worth, Texas Category:Deaths from Alzheimer's disease Category:Academics from Ohio Category:Writers from Cleveland Category:Sportspeople from Cleveland Category:Disease-related deaths in Connecticut
title: Frank Ryan (American football)
